```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, comment = NA,
                      options(digits = 3, scipen = 999))
library(tidyverse)
library(plm)
library(stargazer)
df <- # data
  here::here("data", "covid_data_final.csv") %>% 
  read_csv() %>% 
  filter(date >= "2020-03-01")

sc_names <-
  df %>%
  names() 

soc_cap_measures <- sc_names[c(14:17, 46:53)]
```



# Table 2

```{r table-2, results='asis', eval=TRUE}
stargazer(
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "twoways",
      index = "state",
      method = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2) +
        median_household_income +
        percent_adults_with_ba +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health +
        percent_black +
        density +
        percent_rural +
        percent_65 +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation,
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * state_level_index  +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2) +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health |
        median_household_income +
        percent_adults_with_ba +
        percent_black +
        density +
        percent_rural +
        percent_65 +
        average_temperature +
        governor_political_affiliation +
        percent_in_fair_or_poor_health +
        stringency_index_lag +
        I(stringency_index_lag) ^ 2,
      data = .,
      effect = "time",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ),
  type = "latex",
  df = FALSE,
  covariate.labels = c(
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$",
    "Social K",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency}_{t-7}^2$",
    "Median Income",
    "\\% Bachelor's",
    "\\% Fair/Poor Health",
    "\\% Black",
    "Population Density",
    "\\% Rural",
    "\\% > 65",
    "Average Temperature",
    "Republican Governor",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$ * Social K"
  ),
  title = "Fixed Effects Regression Results",
  dep.var.labels = "Daily New Cases per Million",
  column.labels = c("$\\mathrm{FE_{i,t}}$", "$\\mathrm{FE_t}$", "$\\mathrm{FE_t}$", "$\\mathrm{IVFE_t}$"),
  header = FALSE
)
```

# Table 4

```{r table-4, results='asis', eval=TRUE}
table_3_models <- list()

for (i in 1:4) {
  # for(i in 1:1)  {
  # sc_i <- soc_cap_measures[i]
  
  table_3_models[[i]] <-
    df %>%
    plm(
      cases_new ~ stringency_index_lag * get(soc_cap_measures[i]) +
        I(stringency_index_lag ^ 2),
      data = .,
      effect = "twoways",
      index = "state",
      model = "within"
    ) 
}

names(table_3_models) <- soc_cap_measures[1:4]


stargazer(
  table_3_models,
  type = "latex",
  model.names = FALSE,
  df = FALSE,
  covariate.labels = c(
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency}_{t-7}^2$",
    "$\\mathrm{Stringency_{t-7}}$ * Social K"
  ),
  title = "Alternative Measures Social Capital Regression Results",
  dep.var.labels = "Daily New Cases per Million",
  header = FALSE,
  column.labels = c(
    "Penn State Index",
    "Putnam Index",
    "Alesina La Ferrara",
    "Family Prosperity Index"
  )
)
```
